name: BioMistral-7B
training_data_summary: Further pre-trained on PubMed Central Open Access articles; multilingual eval in paper.
benchmarks: [{"name": "BioMistral paper 10 medical QA tasks", "score": "competitive vs opensource"}]
eval_notes: Strong open biomedical chat LLM; pair with RAG over PubMed/USDA for grounded answers.
safety: {"risk_flags": ["medical advice risk"], "known_limits": "Not a clinician; may hallucinate; needs citations.", "mitigations": ["RAG", "citation", "dose ranges caps", "guardrails filters"]}
deployment: {"hardware": "1x A10/3090 or CPU via GGUF", "quantization": "4-bit/gguf/gptq", "throughput_estimate": "15-25 tok/s on A10", "memory_estimate": "~14-16GB (fp16), ~6-8GB (int4)"}
localization: {"sr_RS": "ok", "notes": "SR via generalization; recommend RAG over SR sources."}

name: BioMistral-7B (GGUF / llamafile variants)
training_data_summary: Variant packaging of BioMistral for local single-file inference.
eval_notes: Great for CPU/local demos; use for on-edge risk checks + offline mode.
safety: {"risk_flags": ["medical advice risk"], "known_limits": "Same as base; ensure guardrails.", "mitigations": ["disclaimers", "filters"]}

name: USDA FoodData Central (FDC)
training_data_summary: Nutrient profiles for branded & generic foods; FNDDS, SR Legacy, Foundation Foods.
eval_notes: Primary nutrient ground truth; CC0 (public domain).
safety: {"risk_flags": [], "known_limits": "Some branded items stale; watch portion mapping.", "mitigations": ["normalize to grams", "map to FDC IDs"]}

name: openFDA (SPL Labels)
training_data_summary: Structured labels for drugs and some OTC; warnings/contraindications; CC0.
eval_notes: Use for interaction warnings and safety disclaimers; supplements are limitedâ€”pair with DSLD/ODS.
safety: {"risk_flags": [], "known_limits": "Primarily drugs; limited supplement coverage.", "mitigations": ["combine with DSLD, ODS fact sheets"]}

name: Open Reaction Database (ORD)
training_data_summary: Open schema & repository for organic reactions; used to train forward/retro models.
eval_notes: Use for condition & reaction knowledge; combine with ORDerly for clean ML splits.
safety: {"risk_flags": ["lab safety"], "known_limits": "Heterogeneous quality; patents vs non-patent splits.", "mitigations": ["filtering", "role assignment"]}
license: {"type": "Varies (datasets often CC-BY 4.0)", "url": "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11094788/", "commercial_use": true, "notes": "ORDerly datasets are CC BY 4.0; ORD core is open-access."}

name: ORDerly Benchmarks
training_data_summary: Framework to prep ORD data; forward/retro/condition prediction benchmarks; datasets CC BY 4.0.
eval_notes: Useful for validating chemical models used for bioavailability/stability heuristics.

name: NIH DSLD (Dietary Supplement Label Database)
training_data_summary: Labels & ingredients for US dietary supplements.
eval_notes: Pairs with ODS Fact Sheets to map dosages and warnings; license terms to verify.
safety: {"risk_flags": [], "known_limits": "Coverage varies; ingredient normalization needed.", "mitigations": ["map to ChEBI/PubChem", "dedupe brands"]}

name: Mistral 7B (base)
training_data_summary: General-purpose model with Apache-2.0; strong performance; foundation for BioMistral.
eval_notes: Use as fallback for general reasoning combined with RAG over domain sources.
